25namespace v8 {
26namespace internal {
27namespace wasm {
28
29#define TRACE(...) \
30 do { \
31 if (v8_flags.trace_wasm_decoder) PrintF(__VA_ARGS__); \
32 } while (false)
33#define TRACE_IF(cond, ...) \
34 do { \
35 if (v8_flags.trace_wasm_decoder && (cond)) PrintF(__VA_ARGS__); \
36 } while (false)
37
38// A {DecodeResult} only stores the failure / success status, but no data.
39using DecodeResult = VoidResult;
40
41struct WasmFunction;
42
43class ITracer {
44 public:
45 static constexpr ITracer* NoTrace = nullptr;
46
47 // Hooks for extracting byte offsets of things.
48 virtual void TypeOffset(uint32_t offset) = 0;
49 virtual void ImportOffset(uint32_t offset) = 0;
50 virtual void ImportsDone(const WasmModule* module) = 0;
51 virtual void TableOffset(uint32_t offset) = 0;
52 virtual void MemoryOffset(uint32_t offset) = 0;
53 virtual void TagOffset(uint32_t offset) = 0;
54 virtual void GlobalOffset(uint32_t offset) = 0;
55 virtual void StartOffset(uint32_t offset) = 0;
56 virtual void ElementOffset(uint32_t offset) = 0;
57 virtual void DataOffset(uint32_t offset) = 0;
58 virtual void StringOffset(uint32_t offset) = 0;
59 virtual void RecGroupOffset(uint32_t offset, uint32_t group_size) = 0;
60
61 // Hooks for annotated hex dumps.
62 virtual void Bytes(const uint8_t* start, uint32_t count) = 0;
63
64 virtual void Description(const char* desc) = 0;
65 virtual void Description(const char* desc, size_t length) = 0;
66 virtual void Description(uint32_t number) = 0;
67 virtual void Description(ValueType type) = 0;
68 virtual void Description(HeapType type) = 0;
69 virtual void Description(const FunctionSig* sig) = 0;
70
71 virtual void NextLine() = 0;
72 virtual void NextLineIfFull() = 0;
73 virtual void NextLineIfNonEmpty() = 0;
74
75 virtual void InitializerExpression(const uint8_t* start, const uint8_t* end,
76 ValueType expected_type) = 0;
77 virtual void FunctionBody(const WasmFunction* func, const uint8_t* start) = 0;
78 virtual void FunctionName(uint32_t func_index) = 0;
79 virtual void NameSection(const uint8_t* start, const uint8_t* end,
80 uint32_t offset) = 0;
81
82 virtual ~ITracer() = default;
83};
84
85// A helper utility to decode bytes, integers, fields, varints, etc, from
86// a buffer of bytes.
87class Decoder {
88 public:
89 // Don't run validation, assume valid input.
90 static constexpr struct NoValidationTag {
91 static constexpr bool validate = false;
92 static constexpr bool full_validation = false;
93 } kNoValidation = {};
94 // Run validation but only store a generic error.
95 static constexpr struct BooleanValidationTag {
96 static constexpr bool validate = true;
97 static constexpr bool full_validation = false;
98 } kBooleanValidation = {};
99 // Run full validation with error message and location.
100 static constexpr struct FullValidationTag {
101 static constexpr bool validate = true;
102 static constexpr bool full_validation = true;
103 } kFullValidation = {};
104
105 struct NoName {
106 constexpr NoName(const char*) {}
107 operator const char*() const { UNREACHABLE(); }
108 };
109 // Pass a {NoName} if we know statically that we do not use it anyway (we are
110 // not tracing (in release mode) and not running full validation).
111#ifdef DEBUG
112 template <typename ValidationTag>
113 using Name = const char*;
114#else
115 template <typename ValidationTag>
116 using Name =
117 std::conditional_t<ValidationTag::full_validation, const char*, NoName>;
118#endif
119
120 enum TraceFlag : bool { kTrace = true, kNoTrace = false };
121
122 Decoder(const uint8_t* start, const uint8_t* end, uint32_t buffer_offset = 0)
123 : Decoder(start, start, end, buffer_offset) {}
124 explicit Decoder(const base::Vector<const uint8_t> bytes,
125 uint32_t buffer_offset = 0)
126 : Decoder(bytes.begin(), bytes.begin() + bytes.length(), buffer_offset) {}
127 Decoder(const uint8_t* start, const uint8_t* pc, const uint8_t* end,
128 uint32_t buffer_offset = 0)
129 : start_(start), pc_(pc), end_(end), buffer_offset_(buffer_offset) {
130 DCHECK_LE(start, pc);
131 DCHECK_LE(pc, end);
132 DCHECK_EQ(static_cast<uint32_t>(end - start), end - start);
133 }
134
135 virtual ~Decoder() = default;
136
137 // Reads an 8-bit unsigned integer.
138 template <typename ValidationTag>
139 uint8_t read_u8(const uint8_t* pc,
140 Name<ValidationTag> msg = "expected 1 byte") {
141 return read_little_endian<uint8_t, ValidationTag>(pc, msg);
142 }
143
144 // Reads a 16-bit unsigned integer (little endian).
145 template <typename ValidationTag>
146 uint16_t read_u16(const uint8_t* pc,
147 Name<ValidationTag> msg = "expected 2 bytes") {
148 return read_little_endian<uint16_t, ValidationTag>(pc, msg);
149 }
150
151 // Reads a 32-bit unsigned integer (little endian).
152 template <typename ValidationTag>
153 uint32_t read_u32(const uint8_t* pc,
154 Name<ValidationTag> msg = "expected 4 bytes") {
155 return read_little_endian<uint32_t, ValidationTag>(pc, msg);
156 }
157
158 // Reads a 64-bit unsigned integer (little endian).
159 template <typename ValidationTag>
160 uint64_t read_u64(const uint8_t* pc,
161 Name<ValidationTag> msg = "expected 8 bytes") {
162 return read_little_endian<uint64_t, ValidationTag>(pc, msg);
163 }
164
165 // Reads a variable-length unsigned integer (little endian). Returns the read
166 // value and the number of bytes read.
167 template <typename ValidationTag>
168 std::pair<uint32_t, uint32_t> read_u32v(const uint8_t* pc,
169 Name<ValidationTag> name = "LEB32") {
170 return read_leb<uint32_t, ValidationTag, kNoTrace>(pc, name);
171 }
172
173 // Reads a variable-length signed integer (little endian). Returns the read
174 // value and the number of bytes read.
175 template <typename ValidationTag>
176 std::pair<int32_t, uint32_t> read_i32v(
177 const uint8_t* pc, Name<ValidationTag> name = "signed LEB32") {
178 return read_leb<int32_t, ValidationTag, kNoTrace>(pc, name);
179 }
180
181 // Reads a variable-length unsigned integer (little endian). Returns the read
182 // value and the number of bytes read.
183 template <typename ValidationTag>
184 std::pair<uint64_t, uint32_t> read_u64v(const uint8_t* pc,
185 Name<ValidationTag> name = "LEB64") {
186 return read_leb<uint64_t, ValidationTag, kNoTrace>(pc, name);
187 }
188
189 // Reads a variable-length signed integer (little endian). Returns the read
190 // value and the number of bytes read.
191 template <typename ValidationTag>
192 std::pair<int64_t, uint32_t> read_i64v(
193 const uint8_t* pc, Name<ValidationTag> name = "signed LEB64") {
194 return read_leb<int64_t, ValidationTag, kNoTrace>(pc, name);
195 }
196
197 // Reads a variable-length 33-bit signed integer (little endian). Returns the
198 // read value and the number of bytes read.
199 template <typename ValidationTag>
200 std::pair<int64_t, uint32_t> read_i33v(
201 const uint8_t* pc, Name<ValidationTag> name = "signed LEB33") {
202 return read_leb<int64_t, ValidationTag, kNoTrace, 33>(pc, name);
203 }
204
205 // Reads a prefixed-opcode, possibly with variable-length index.
206 // Returns the read opcode and the number of bytes that make up this opcode,
207 // *including* the prefix byte. For most opcodes, it will be 2.
208 template <typename ValidationTag>
209 std::pair<WasmOpcode, uint32_t> read_prefixed_opcode(
210 const uint8_t* pc, Name<ValidationTag> name = "prefixed opcode") {
211 // Prefixed opcodes all use LEB128 encoding.
212 auto [index, index_length] =
213 read_u32v<ValidationTag>(pc + 1, "prefixed opcode index");
214 uint32_t length = index_length + 1; // 1 for prefix byte.
215 // Only support opcodes that go up to 0xFFF (when decoded). Anything
216 // bigger will need more than 2 bytes, and the '<< 12' below will be wrong.
217 if (ValidationTag::validate && V8_UNLIKELY(index > 0xfff)) {
218 errorf(pc, "Invalid prefixed opcode %d", index);
219 // On validation failure we return "unreachable" (opcode 0).
220 static_assert(kExprUnreachable == 0);
221 return {kExprUnreachable, 0};
222 }
223
224 if (index > 0xff) {
225 return {static_cast<WasmOpcode>((*pc) << 12 | index), length};
226 }
227
228 return {static_cast<WasmOpcode>((*pc) << 8 | index), length};
229 }
230
231 // Reads a 8-bit unsigned integer (byte) and advances {pc_}.
232 uint8_t consume_u8(const char* name = "uint8_t") {
233 return consume_little_endian<uint8_t, kTrace>(name);
234 }
235 uint8_t consume_u8(const char* name, ITracer* tracer) {
236 if (tracer) {
237 tracer->Bytes(pc_, sizeof(uint8_t));
238 tracer->Description(name);
239 }
240 return consume_little_endian<uint8_t, kNoTrace>(name);
241 }
242
243 // Reads a 16-bit unsigned integer (little endian) and advances {pc_}.
244 uint16_t consume_u16(const char* name = "uint16_t") {
245 return consume_little_endian<uint16_t, kTrace>(name);
246 }
247
248 // Reads a single 32-bit unsigned integer (little endian) and advances {pc_}.
249 uint32_t consume_u32(const char* name, ITracer* tracer) {
250 if (tracer) {
251 tracer->Bytes(pc_, sizeof(uint32_t));
252 tracer->Description(name);
253 }
254 return consume_little_endian<uint32_t, kNoTrace>(name);
255 }
256
257 // Reads a LEB128 variable-length unsigned 32-bit integer and advances {pc_}.
258 uint32_t consume_u32v(const char* name = "var_uint32") {
259 auto [result, length] =
260 read_leb<uint32_t, FullValidationTag, kTrace>(pc_, name);
261 pc_ += length;
262 return result;
263 }
264 uint32_t consume_u32v(const char* name, ITracer* tracer) {
265 auto [result, length] =
266 read_leb<uint32_t, FullValidationTag, kNoTrace>(pc_, name);
267 if (tracer) {
268 tracer->Bytes(pc_, length);
269 tracer->Description(name);
270 }
271 pc_ += length;
272 return result;
273 }
274
275 // Reads a LEB128 variable-length signed 32-bit integer and advances {pc_}.
276 int32_t consume_i32v(const char* name = "var_int32") {
277 auto [result, length] =
278 read_leb<int32_t, FullValidationTag, kTrace>(pc_, name);
279 pc_ += length;
280 return result;
281 }
282
283 // Reads a LEB128 variable-length unsigned 64-bit integer and advances {pc_}.
284 uint64_t consume_u64v(const char* name, ITracer* tracer) {
285 auto [result, length] =
286 read_leb<uint64_t, FullValidationTag, kNoTrace>(pc_, name);
287 if (tracer) {
288 tracer->Bytes(pc_, length);
289 tracer->Description(name);
290 }
291 pc_ += length;
292 return result;
293 }
294
295 // Reads a LEB128 variable-length signed 64-bit integer and advances {pc_}.
296 int64_t consume_i64v(const char* name = "var_int64") {
297 auto [result, length] =
298 read_leb<int64_t, FullValidationTag, kTrace>(pc_, name);
299 pc_ += length;
300 return result;
301 }
302
303 // Consume {size} bytes and send them to the bit bucket, advancing {pc_}.
304 void consume_bytes(uint32_t size, const char* name = "skip") {
305 // Only trace if the name is not null.
306 TRACE_IF(name, " +%u %-20s: %u bytes\n", pc_offset(), name, size);
307 if (checkAvailable(size)) {
308 pc_ += size;
309 } else {
310 pc_ = end_;
311 }
312 }
313 void consume_bytes(uint32_t size, const char* name, ITracer* tracer) {
314 if (tracer) {
315 tracer->Bytes(pc_, size);
316 tracer->Description(name);
317 }
318 consume_bytes(size, nullptr);
319 }
320
321 uint32_t available_bytes() const {
322 DCHECK_LE(pc_, end_);
323 DCHECK_GE(kMaxUInt32, end_ - pc_);
324 return static_cast<uint32_t>(end_ - pc_);
325 }
326
327 // Check that at least {size} bytes exist between {pc_} and {end_}.
328 bool checkAvailable(uint32_t size) {
329 if (V8_UNLIKELY(size > available_bytes())) {
330 errorf(pc_, "expected %u bytes, fell off end", size);
331 return false;
332 }
333 return true;
334 }
335
336 // Use this for "boolean validation", i.e. if the error message is not used
337 // anyway.
338 void V8_NOINLINE V8_PRESERVE_MOST MarkError() {
339 if (!ok()) return;
340 error_ = {0, "validation failed"};
341 onFirstError();
342 }
343
344 // Do not inline error methods. This has measurable impact on validation time,
345 // see https://crbug.com/910432.
346 void V8_NOINLINE V8_PRESERVE_MOST error(const char* msg) {
347 errorf(pc_offset(), "%s", msg);
348 }
349 void V8_NOINLINE V8_PRESERVE_MOST error(const uint8_t* pc, const char* msg) {
350 errorf(pc_offset(pc), "%s", msg);
351 }
352 void V8_NOINLINE V8_PRESERVE_MOST error(uint32_t offset, const char* msg) {
353 errorf(offset, "%s", msg);
354 }
355
356 template <typename... Args>
357 void V8_NOINLINE V8_PRESERVE_MOST errorf(const char* format, Args... args) {
358 errorf(pc_offset(), format, args...);
359 }
360
361 template <typename... Args>
362 void V8_NOINLINE V8_PRESERVE_MOST errorf(const uint8_t* pc,
363 const char* format, Args... args) {
364 errorf(pc_offset(pc), format, args...);
365 }
366
367 template <typename... Args>
368 void V8_NOINLINE V8_PRESERVE_MOST errorf(uint32_t offset, const char* format,
369 Args... args) {
370 static_assert(
371 sizeof...(Args) > 0,
372 "Use error instead of errorf if the format string has no placeholders");
373 verrorf(offset, format, args...);
374 }
375
376 // Behavior triggered on first error, overridden in subclasses.
377 virtual void onFirstError() {}
378
379 // Debugging helper to print a bytes range as hex bytes.
380 void traceByteRange(const uint8_t* start, const uint8_t* end) {
381 DCHECK_LE(start, end);
382 for (const uint8_t* p = start; p < end; ++p) TRACE("%02x ", *p);
383 }
384
385 // Debugging helper to print bytes up to the end.
386 void traceOffEnd() {
387 traceByteRange(pc_, end_);
388 TRACE("<end>\n");
389 }
390
391 // Converts the given value to a {Result}, copying the error if necessary.
392 template <typename T, typename R = std::decay_t<T>>
393 Result<R> toResult(T&& val) {
394 if (failed()) {
395 TRACE("Result error: %s\n", error_.message().c_str());
396 return Result<R>{error_};
397 }
398 return Result<R>{std::forward<T>(val)};
399 }
400
401 // Resets the boundaries of this decoder.
402 void Reset(const uint8_t* start, const uint8_t* end,
403 uint32_t buffer_offset = 0) {
404 DCHECK_LE(start, end);
405 DCHECK_EQ(static_cast<uint32_t>(end - start), end - start);
406 start_ = start;
407 pc_ = start;
408 end_ = end;
409 buffer_offset_ = buffer_offset;
410 error_ = {};
411 }
412
413 void Reset(base::Vector<const uint8_t> bytes, uint32_t buffer_offset = 0) {
414 Reset(bytes.begin(), bytes.end(), buffer_offset);
415 }
416
417 bool ok() const { return !failed(); }
418 bool failed() const { return error_.has_error(); }
419 bool more() const { return pc_ < end_; }
420 const WasmError& error() const { return error_; }
421
422 const uint8_t* start() const { return start_; }
423 const uint8_t* pc() const { return pc_; }
424 uint32_t V8_INLINE position() const {
425 return static_cast<uint32_t>(pc_ - start_);
426 }
427 // This needs to be inlined for performance (see https://crbug.com/910432).
428 uint32_t V8_INLINE pc_offset(const uint8_t* pc) const {
429 DCHECK_LE(start_, pc);
430 DCHECK_GE(kMaxUInt32 - buffer_offset_, pc - start_);
431 return static_cast<uint32_t>(pc - start_) + buffer_offset_;
432 }
433 uint32_t pc_offset() const { return pc_offset(pc_); }
434 uint32_t buffer_offset() const { return buffer_offset_; }
435 // Takes an offset relative to the module start and returns an offset relative
436 // to the current buffer of the decoder.
437 uint32_t GetBufferRelativeOffset(uint32_t offset) const {
438 DCHECK_LE(buffer_offset_, offset);
439 return offset - buffer_offset_;
440 }
441 const uint8_t* end() const { return end_; }
442 void set_end(const uint8_t* end) { end_ = end; }
443
444 // Check if the uint8_t at {offset} from the current pc equals {expected}.
445 bool lookahead(int offset, uint8_t expected) {
446 DCHECK_LE(pc_, end_);
447 return end_ - pc_ > offset && pc_[offset] == expected;
448 }
449
450 protected:
451 const uint8_t* start_;
452 const uint8_t* pc_;
453 const uint8_t* end_;
454 // The offset of the current buffer in the module. Needed for streaming.
455 uint32_t buffer_offset_;
456 WasmError error_;
457
458 private:
459 void V8_NOINLINE PRINTF_FORMAT(3, 4)
460 verrorf(uint32_t offset, const char* format, ...) {
461 // Only report the first error.
462 if (!ok()) return;
463 constexpr int kMaxErrorMsg = 256;
464 base::EmbeddedVector<char, kMaxErrorMsg> buffer;
465 va_list args;
466 va_start(args, format);
467 int len = base::VSNPrintF(buffer, format, args);
468 va_end(args);
469 CHECK_LT(0, len);
470 error_ = {offset, {buffer.begin(), static_cast<size_t>(len)}};
471 onFirstError();
472 }
473
474 template <typename IntType, typename ValidationTag>
475 IntType read_little_endian(const uint8_t* pc, Name<ValidationTag> msg) {
476 DCHECK_LE(start_, pc);
477
478 if (!ValidationTag::validate) {
479 DCHECK_LE(pc, end_);
480 DCHECK_LE(sizeof(IntType), end_ - pc);
481 } else if (V8_UNLIKELY(ptrdiff_t{sizeof(IntType)} > end_ - pc)) {
482 if (ValidationTag::full_validation) {
483 error(pc, msg);
484 } else {
485 MarkError();
486 }
487 return 0;
488 }
489 return base::ReadLittleEndianValue<IntType>(reinterpret_cast<Address>(pc));
490 }
491
492 template <typename IntType, TraceFlag trace>
493 IntType consume_little_endian(const char* name) {
494 TRACE_IF(trace, " +%u %-20s: ", pc_offset(), name);
495 if (!checkAvailable(sizeof(IntType))) {
496 traceOffEnd();
497 pc_ = end_;
498 return IntType{0};
499 }
500 IntType val = read_little_endian<IntType, NoValidationTag>(pc_, name);
501 traceByteRange(pc_, pc_ + sizeof(IntType));
502 TRACE_IF(trace, "= %d\n", val);
503 pc_ += sizeof(IntType);
504 return val;
505 }
506
507 // The implementation of LEB-decoding; returns the value and the number of
508 // bytes read.
509 template <typename IntType, typename ValidationTag, TraceFlag trace,
510 size_t size_in_bits = 8 * sizeof(IntType)>
511 V8_INLINE std::pair<IntType, uint32_t> read_leb(
512 const uint8_t* pc, Name<ValidationTag> name = "varint") {
513 static_assert(size_in_bits <= 8 * sizeof(IntType),
514 "leb does not fit in type");
515 TRACE_IF(trace, " +%u %-20s: ", pc_offset(),
516 implicit_cast<const char*>(name));
517 // Fast path for single-byte integers.
518 if (V8_LIKELY((!ValidationTag::validate || pc < end_) && !(*pc & 0x80))) {
519 TRACE_IF(trace, "%02x ", *pc);
520 IntType result = *pc;
521 if (std::is_signed<IntType>::value) {
522 // Perform sign extension.
523 constexpr int sign_ext_shift = int{8 * sizeof(IntType)} - 7;
524 result = (result << sign_ext_shift) >> sign_ext_shift;
525 TRACE_IF(trace, "= %" PRIi64 "\n", static_cast<int64_t>(result));
526 } else {
527 TRACE_IF(trace, "= %" PRIu64 "\n", static_cast<uint64_t>(result));
528 }
529 return {result, 1};
530 }
531 auto [result, length] =
532 read_leb_slowpath<IntType, ValidationTag, trace, size_in_bits>(pc,
533 name);
534 V8_ASSUME(length >= 0 && length <= (size_in_bits + 6) / 7);
535 V8_ASSUME(ValidationTag::validate || length >= 1);
536 return {result, length};
537 }
538
539 template <typename IntType, typename ValidationTag, TraceFlag trace,
540 size_t size_in_bits = 8 * sizeof(IntType)>
541 V8_NOINLINE V8_PRESERVE_MOST std::pair<IntType, uint32_t> read_leb_slowpath(
542 const uint8_t* pc, Name<ValidationTag> name) {
543 // Create an unrolled LEB decoding function per integer type.
544 return read_leb_tail<IntType, ValidationTag, trace, size_in_bits, 0>(
545 pc, name, 0);
546 }
547
548 template <typename IntType, typename ValidationTag, TraceFlag trace,
549 size_t size_in_bits, int byte_index>
550 V8_INLINE std::pair<IntType, uint32_t> read_leb_tail(
551 const uint8_t* pc, Name<ValidationTag> name,
552 IntType intermediate_result) {
553 constexpr bool is_signed = std::is_signed<IntType>::value;
554 constexpr int kMaxLength = (size_in_bits + 6) / 7;
555 static_assert(byte_index < kMaxLength, "invalid template instantiation");
556 constexpr int shift = byte_index * 7;
557 constexpr bool is_last_byte = byte_index == kMaxLength - 1;
558 const bool at_end = ValidationTag::validate && pc >= end_;
559 uint8_t b = 0;
560 if (V8_LIKELY(!at_end)) {
561 DCHECK_LT(pc, end_);
562 b = *pc;
563 TRACE_IF(trace, "%02x ", b);
564 using Unsigned = typename std::make_unsigned<IntType>::type;
565 intermediate_result |=
566 (static_cast<Unsigned>(static_cast<IntType>(b) & 0x7f) << shift);
567 }
568 if (!is_last_byte && (b & 0x80)) {
569 // Make sure that we only instantiate the template for valid byte indexes.
570 // Compilers are not smart enough to figure out statically that the
571 // following call is unreachable if is_last_byte is false.
572 constexpr int next_byte_index = byte_index + (is_last_byte ? 0 : 1);
573 return read_leb_tail<IntType, ValidationTag, trace, size_in_bits,
574 next_byte_index>(pc + 1, name, intermediate_result);
575 }
576 if (ValidationTag::validate && V8_UNLIKELY(at_end || (b & 0x80))) {
577 TRACE_IF(trace, at_end ? "<end> " : "<length overflow> ");
578 if constexpr (ValidationTag::full_validation) {
579 errorf(pc, "%s while decoding %s",
580 at_end ? "reached end" : "length overflow", name);
581 } else {
582 MarkError();
583 }
584 return {0, 0};
585 }
586 if constexpr (is_last_byte) {
587 // A signed-LEB128 must sign-extend the final byte, excluding its
588 // most-significant bit; e.g. for a 32-bit LEB128:
589 // kExtraBits = 4 (== 32 - (5-1) * 7)
590 // For unsigned values, the extra bits must be all zero.
591 // For signed values, the extra bits *plus* the most significant bit must
592 // either be 0, or all ones.
593 constexpr int kExtraBits = size_in_bits - ((kMaxLength - 1) * 7);
594 constexpr int kSignExtBits = kExtraBits - (is_signed ? 1 : 0);
595 const uint8_t checked_bits = b & (0xFF << kSignExtBits);
596 constexpr uint8_t kSignExtendedExtraBits = 0x7f & (0xFF << kSignExtBits);
597 const bool valid_extra_bits =
598 checked_bits == 0 ||
599 (is_signed && checked_bits == kSignExtendedExtraBits);
600 if (!ValidationTag::validate) {
601 DCHECK(valid_extra_bits);
602 } else if (V8_UNLIKELY(!valid_extra_bits)) {
603 if (ValidationTag::full_validation) {
604 error(pc, "extra bits in varint");
605 } else {
606 MarkError();
607 }
608 return {0, 0};
609 }
610 }
611 constexpr int sign_ext_shift =
612 is_signed ? std::max(0, int{8 * sizeof(IntType)} - shift - 7) : 0;
613 // Perform sign extension.
614 intermediate_result =
615 (intermediate_result << sign_ext_shift) >> sign_ext_shift;
616 if (trace && is_signed) {
617 TRACE("= %" PRIi64 "\n", static_cast<int64_t>(intermediate_result));
618 } else if (trace) {
619 TRACE("= %" PRIu64 "\n", static_cast<uint64_t>(intermediate_result));
620 }
621 const uint32_t length = byte_index + 1;
622 return {intermediate_result, length};
623 }
624};
625
626#undef TRACE
627} // namespace wasm
628} // namespace internal
629} // namespace v8
630
631#endif // V8_WASM_DECODER_H_

uint32_t
